meanings.sent1: The decision was appealable, so we could ask for it to be looked at again.
meanings.sent2: The judge explained that any ruling made in court is appealable if one disagrees.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer joked that even the coffee in the courthouse cafeteria was appealable.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an appealable invitation to join her in the dance.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a second chance was made more real by the appealable nature of the verdict.

meanings.definition: Able to be challenged or questioned in a higher court.
meanings.sent1: The verdict was appealable, so the case could be taken to a higher court.
meanings.sent2: In the legal system, any decision made by a lower court is appealable in a higher court.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ability to open the door was so impressive, it seemed almost appealable in a court of law.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as strong and appealable as a beacon in the night.
meanings.sent5: The mountain of evidence against him made his guilt appealable in the eyes of the law.

meanings.definition: Deserving of further consideration or review.
meanings.sent1: The new evidence presented was appealable, prompting a reevaluation of the case.
meanings.sent2: When mistakes are made, it is important to have an appealable process for correction.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having dessert before dinner was so appealing, it was almost appealable.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was an appealable quality that drew others to her effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset was so appealable that it left everyone in awe.
